overview: From 2025-07-20 to 2025-07-27, elizaos/eliza had 16 new PRs (14 merged), 25 new issues, and 17 active contributors.

topIssues.title: pino-pretty errors in export builds from bun - replace pino with adze
topIssues.author: lalalune
topIssues.body:
Our logger is not compatible with the bun binary compilation and build process. Since its built into the core, its very hard to get into and override, so we should rip it out and use a bun compatible logger instead. After some research, I think this is a good option: https://adzejs.com/

We could also just roll our own logging, but then we need color formatting and all that and I'd rather just have something that already works and is easy to drop in.

Please replace pino and all pino-related dependencies with adze and make sure everything works and all tests still pass @claude

topPRs.title: feat: Add Clanker Plugin with SDK v4.0.0 Integration
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## 🚀 Clanker Protocol Plugin for ElizaOS

This PR introduces a comprehensive Clanker protocol integration plugin that enables advanced token deployment and management on Base L2 using Clanker SDK v4.0.0.

### 🎯 **Key Features**

#### **Core Functionality**
- **🪙 Token Deployment**: Advanced token deployment with Clanker SDK v4.0.0
- **📊 Token Information**: Comprehensive token data queries  
- **💰 Balance Checking**: Wallet and token balance monitoring
- **🎯 Vanity Addresses**: Custom address suffix generation

#### **Advanced Configuration**
- **🏊 Pool Configuration**: Custom liquidity positions and fee structures
- **🏆 Reward Management**: Creator rewards and fee distribution
- **🔒 Vault & Vesting**: Token supply locking with custom schedules
- **💸 Initial Dev Purchases**: Automated initial market making
- **🎨 Rich Metadata**: IPFS images, social links, audit URLs

#### **Legacy Operations (Properly Deprecated)**
- **⚠️ Liquidity Management**: Redirects to Uniswap v4
- **⚠️ Token Swapping**: Redirects to dedicated DEX integrations

---

### 🧪 **Comprehensive Testing - 85%+ Coverage**

#### **Test Statistics**
- **Test Files**: 9 comprehensive test suites
- **Test Cases**: 200+ individual scenarios
- **Lines of Test Code**: 2,500+ lines
- **Coverage**: All critical user-facing functionality

#### **Test Categories**
- ✅ **Services** (100%): Clanker SDK integration, wallet operations
- ✅ **Actions** (100%): Token deployment, info queries, balance checks, deprecated operations  
- ✅ **Utilities** (100%): Error handling, formatting, validation
- ✅ **Core** (100%): Plugin initialization and configuration

#### **Quality Features**
- 🔄 **Edge Cases**: Invalid inputs, service failures, network issues
- 🎭 **Comprehensive Mocking**: Type-safe service simulation
- 📊 **SDK Integration**: Tests actual Clanker v4.0.0 patterns
- 🚨 **Error Scenarios**: Network timeouts, insufficient funds, validation
- 🔧 **Backwards Compatibility**: Proper deprecation handling

---

### 🏗️ **Technical Architecture**

#### **Services Layer**
- **ClankerService**: Clanker SDK v4.0.0 integration with advanced config support
- **WalletService**: Ethers.js wallet management with transaction handling

#### **Actions Layer**
- **tokenDeployAction**: Natural language → Clanker API parameter conversion
- **tokenInfoAction**: Token data retrieval with formatting
- **balanceCheckAction**: Wallet/token balance queries
- **liquidityManagementAction**: Proper deprecation handling
- **tokenSwapAction**: Proper deprecation handling

#### **Support Layer**
- **Providers**: Token context and market data
- **Evaluators**: Deployment success analysis
- **Utilities**: Error handling, formatting, validation

---

### 📊 **Clanker SDK v4.0.0 Integration**

#### **New Features Supported**
- ✅ Vanity address generation with custom suffixes
- ✅ Advanced pool configuration with custom tick positions  
- ✅ Comprehensive reward distribution (up to 7 recipients)
- ✅ Token supply vesting with lockup + linear vesting periods
- ✅ Initial dev purchases with automated market making
- ✅ Rich metadata with IPFS images and social links
- ✅ Social provenance context validation

#### **Breaking Changes Handled**
- ✅ Fixed token supply (1B tokens) instead of custom amounts
- ✅ Fixed decimals (18) instead of custom precision
- ✅ Required `tokenAdmin` parameter for permissions
- ✅ Enhanced metadata structure for social verification

---

### 🔐 **Security & Production Readiness**

#### **Security Features**
- 🔑 Private key protection with environment variables
- ⛽ Gas price monitoring and limits
- ✅ Comprehensive parameter validation
- 🚨 Proper error handling with user-friendly messages
- 🔄 Transaction retry logic with exponential backoff

#### **Production Features**
- 📚 Comprehensive documentation with examples
- 🚨 Troubleshooting guide for common issues  
- ⚠️ Migration guide from legacy versions
- 🔧 Development workflow documentation
- 📊 Architecture diagrams and component descriptions

---

### 🎯 **Usage Examples**

#### **Simple Deployment**
```
"Deploy a new token called MyToken with symbol MTK"
"Create a memecoin called PEPE with vanity address"
```

#### **Advanced Deployment**
```typescript
await clankerService.deployToken({
  name: "Advanced Token",
  symbol: "ADV", 
  vanity: true,
  vault: { percentage: 10, lockupDuration: 2592000, vestingDuration: 2592000 },
  devBuy: { ethAmount: 0.1 },
  rewards: { recipients: [{ recipient: "0x...", bps: 8000, token: "Paired" }] }
});
```

#### **Information Queries**
```
"Get info for token 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef12345678"
"What is the price and market cap of BASE token?"
"Check my wallet balance"
```

---

### ⚡ **Files Changed**

- **36 files added** with 6,271 lines of code
- **Source Files**: Complete plugin architecture with services, actions, providers
- **Test Files**: Comprehensive test coverage across all components
- **Documentation**: Production-ready README with examples and guides
- **Configuration**: TypeScript config, build setup, package.json

---

### 🚀 **Ready for Review**

This plugin is production-ready with:
- ✅ Comprehensive test coverage (85%+)
- ✅ Full Clanker SDK v4.0.0 integration  
- ✅ Proper deprecation handling for legacy features
- ✅ Security best practices implemented
- ✅ Complete documentation and examples
- ✅ TypeScript type safety throughout
- ✅ Error resilience and user-friendly messages

**Testing**: Run `bun test` in `packages/plugin-clanker/` to verify all tests pass.

**Documentation**: See comprehensive README with usage examples, architecture details, and troubleshooting guides.

topPRs.title: feature/docker starter
topPRs.author: bealers
topPRs.body:
# Docker Infrastructure for elizaOS - foundation stage

Adds Docker support with CLI integration and organized target structure for both starter projects and monorepo development.

## New Commands

```bash
# Development with hot reload
elizaos dev --docker

# Production deployment  
elizaos start --docker
```

## How It Works

### Starter Project Context
When using `elizaos create my-project`, the generated project includes Docker configs:

```bash
elizaos create my-project
cd my-project
elizaos dev --docker    # Starts containerized dev environment
elizaos start --docker  # Starts production-ready container
```

**Benefits:**
- **Consistent environments** across team members
- **No local dependency conflicts** (Node versions, system packages)
- **One-command setup** for new developers
- **Production-like testing** locally

### Monorepo Context
For ElizaOS core development, use organized Docker targets:

```bash
# Development
cd docker/targets/dev && docker-compose up

# Production
cd docker/targets/prod && docker-compose up

# Documentation
cd docker/targets/docs && docker-compose up
```
## Structure

```
docker/targets/
├── dev/     # Development: hot reload, debug ports, volume mounting
├── prod/    # Production: optimized builds, health checks, PostgreSQL
└── docs/    # Documentation: fast nginx serving
```

## Testing

```bash
cd docker/tests && bun test

# Test CLI integration
elizaos create test-project
cd test-project
elizaos dev --docker
```

## Compatibility

- No breaking changes
- TEE functionality preserved (`tee-docker-compose.yaml`)
- Project starter templates include Docker configs 

## Next

- reduce prod image size futher, use `docker-slim`
- take prod image and apply to docker registry
- build out `elizaos deploy`, or similar
- document popular providers, Railway, Digital Ocean, Hetzner

topPRs.title: feat: enhance-logging-rebased
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Introduced advanced logging configuration for ElizaOS agents, including new CLI options for log level, transport (console or file), file path, and JSON formatting.
  * Added an interactive `elizaos logger` CLI command for persistent logging setup.
  * Logging can now be configured via CLI flags, environment variables, or config files, with hybrid console and file output supported.

* **Documentation**
  * Expanded and reorganized documentation for logging, CLI commands, and server testing, including new guides and usage examples.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: enhance logging capabilities in CLI
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/5183

# Risks

**Risk: Low**
- Code cleanup and documentation improvement
- Removes non-functional features to avoid user confusion
- No impact on existing core functionality

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR cleans up the logging system for ElizaOS by removing non-implemented features and updating documentation to reflect actual capabilities:

1. **Code Cleanup**: Removes CloudWatch, Elasticsearch, and multi-transport configurations that were not actually implemented
2. **Simplified CLI Interface**: Streamlined `elizaos logger` command with only functional options
3. **Accurate Documentation**: Updated documentation to reflect only supported features
4. **Clear Transport Options**: Limited to console and file transports (the only working implementations)
5. **Future Planning**: Added section about planned enhancements for transparency

## What kind of change is this?

**Code Cleanup** (non-breaking change which removes non-functional code)
- Removed non-implemented transport configurations
- Simplified CLI interface to show only working options
- Updated documentation for accuracy
- Added future enhancement roadmap

# Documentation changes needed?

**My changes require a change to the project documentation.**
**I have updated the documentation accordingly.**

Updated files:
- `eliza/packages/docs/docs/cli/logger.md` - Removed references to non-implemented transports
- `eliza/packages/cli/src/commands/logger.ts` - Cleaned up interface and configuration types
- `eliza/packages/cli/src/commands/start/index.ts` - Simplified transport validation

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. **CLI Interface**: Test the simplified `elizaos logger` command (should only show console/file options)
2. **Error Handling**: Verify that unsupported transports show appropriate warnings
3. **Documentation**: Review updated documentation for accuracy and clarity
4. **Existing Functionality**: Ensure console and file logging still work correctly

## Detailed testing steps

### CLI Logger Interface
```bash
# Test simplified interactive menu (should only show 2 transport options)
elizaos logger
```

### Transport Validation
```bash
# Test that only supported transports work
elizaos start --log-transport console --log-level debug  # Should work
elizaos start --log-transport file --log-level debug     # Should work

# Test unsupported transport handling (if somehow configured)
# Should show warning and fall back to console
```

### Documentation Verification
- Review `packages/docs/docs/cli/logger.md` - should only mention console/file transports
- Check that CloudWatch/Elasticsearch references are removed
- Verify "Future Enhancements" section explains planned features

## Screenshots

### After - Simplified CLI Menu
```
Select output destination:
❯ Console only
  Console + File (hybrid)
```

### Updated Transport Table
| Transport | Description | CLI Option |
|-----------|-------------|------------|
| `console` | Console output only with pretty formatting | `--log-transport console` |
| `file` | Hybrid: console + file output | `--log-transport file` |

## Documentation Changes

### Added Clarity
- **Available Transports** section clearly listing only supported options
- **Future Enhancements** section explaining planned features
- **Alternative Solutions** for users needing advanced transports

### Updated Examples
- All examples now use only `console` or `file` transports
- Removed confusing CloudWatch/Elasticsearch configuration examples
- Simplified setup instructions

## Benefits

1. **No More User Confusion**: Users won't try to configure non-working features
2. **Honest Documentation**: Documentation accurately reflects actual capabilities
3. **Cleaner Codebase**: Removed dead code and unused configuration options
4. **Better Error Messages**: Clear validation for unsupported transports
5. **Future-Ready**: Clear roadmap for when advanced transports are implemented

## Code Changes Summary

### `packages/cli/src/commands/logger.ts`
- Simplified `LoggerConfig` interface to only include working transports
- Removed CloudWatch/Elasticsearch configuration handling
- Streamlined `displayConfig` function
- Updated transport selection menu

### `packages/cli/src/commands/start/index.ts`
- Updated transport validation logic
- Simplified help text for transport options
- Improved error messages for unsupported transports

### `packages/docs/docs/cli/logger.md`
- Complete rewrite focusing on supported features
- Added transport comparison table
- Added future enhancements section
- Removed misleading examples and configuration sections

## Backward Compatibility

- **Fully Compatible**: All existing functionality continues to work
- **Configuration Files**: Existing configs with unsupported transports will show warnings and fall back to console
- **No Breaking Changes**: Console and file logging work exactly as before

## Future Work

This cleanup sets the foundation for properly implementing advanced transports:
- CloudWatch transport with proper AWS SDK integration
- Elasticsearch transport with connection management
- Multi-transport with proper configuration validation

# Deploy Notes

No special deployment requirements. This is a cleanup that improves user experience by removing confusion about non-working features. 

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced a new CLI command for interactive logging configuration, allowing users to set log level, transport type, file path, and JSON formatting.
  - Added advanced logging options to the CLI, including support for file-based logging, hybrid console/file output, and JSON log formatting.

- **Documentation**
  - Expanded documentation for logging configuration, including a new guide for the logger command and updated instructions for the start command.
  - Updated README and CLI documentation to reflect new logging options and provide detailed usage examples.

- **Style**
  - Minor improvements to code comments and whitespace for clarity.

- **Chores**
  - Updated build configuration to exclude Cypress test files from the server package build process.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: docs: add critical ElizaOS component clarifications to CLAUDE.md
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR adds critical clarifications to CLAUDE.md to help developers understand the correct usage of ElizaOS components (Services, Providers, Actions, Evaluators).

## Changes

### 1. Main CLAUDE.md updates
- Added "CRITICAL: ElizaOS Component Clarifications" section with:
  - Clear distinction between Services vs Providers
  - Clear distinction between Actions vs Evaluators  
  - Correct architecture pattern diagram
  - Plugin structure with required components
  - Common mistakes to avoid
- Added guidance for using parallel Claude code agents for maximum performance

### 2. Created CLAUDE.md files for starter templates
- **packages/plugin-starter/CLAUDE.md**: Complete guide for ElizaOS plugin development
- **packages/project-starter/CLAUDE.md**: Complete guide for ElizaOS agent projects
- Both files include:
  - Detailed component explanations with examples
  - Best practices and common patterns
  - `elizaos dev` and `elizaos start` command documentation
  - Required plugins documentation

### 3. Updated tests
- Updated create.test.ts to verify CLAUDE.md files are properly copied during project creation

## Background

This documentation was created to address widespread confusion about ElizaOS component usage patterns, particularly:
- When to use Services vs Providers
- When to use Actions vs Evaluators
- The requirement for Services when dealing with external APIs
- The read-only nature of Providers

## Impact

These changes will help developers:
- Understand the correct ElizaOS architecture patterns
- Avoid common mistakes when building plugins
- Have clear reference documentation in their projects
- Use parallel agents effectively for better performance

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

completedItems.title: fix: gitignores missing in plugin starter
completedItems.body:
## Problem
   When creating plugins with `elizaos create`, the .gitignore file was not included in the published npm package. This could lead to accidentally committing and pushing sensitive files like .env to GitHub.

   ## Solution
